SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.tui.page

Class Page

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.tui.page.Page
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChatPage, HelpPage, HomePage, OthersPage, WinnerPage
public abstract class Page extends Object
The Page class represents an abstract base class for different pages in the TUI. It provides common functionality and defines abstract methods that need to be implemented by subclasses.
Author:
Tommaso Trabacchin, Melanie Tonarelli, Emanuele Valsecchi, Adem Shehi
See Also:
  • TUI
  • ViewData

  • Method Details

    • show

      public abstract void show()
      Displays the content of the page. This method needs to be implemented by subclasses.

    • getModel

      public ViewData getModel()
      Retrieves the model associated with the page.
      Returns:
      The ViewData object representing the model.
      See Also:
      • ViewData

    • onCurrentPlayerChanged

      public void onCurrentPlayerChanged()
      Notifies the page that the current player has changed. This method is called when there is a new player in the game.

    • onNewMessage

      public void onNewMessage()
      Notifies the page that a new message has been received. This method is called when there is a new message from another player.

    • onException

      public void onException()
      Notifies the page about an exception in the model. This method is called when an exception occurs in the model.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the page by clearing the console.

    • printPointOrPoints

      protected String printPointOrPoints(int point)
      Prints the word point or points based on the given point.
      Parameters:
      point - The number of points.
      Returns:
      The string representation of the points.

      protected void printLineBookShelf(int row, char[][] matrix)
      Prints a line of the bookshelf at the specified row using the given matrix.
      Parameters:
      row - The row number.
      matrix - The character matrix representing the bookshelf.

      protected char[][] fromTileSubjectToChar(TileSubject[][] matrix, boolean board)
      Converts a matrix of TileSubject objects to a matrix of characters.
      Parameters:
      matrix - The matrix of TileSubject objects to convert.
      board - A boolean value indicating if the conversion is for the game board.
      Returns:
      The converted matrix of characters.

    • printOthersBookShelf

      protected void printOthersBookShelf(String nickname1, String nickname2, String nickname3, char[][] bookShelf1, char[][] bookShelf2, char[][] bookShelf3)
      Prints the bookshelves of other players along with their nicknames.
      Parameters:
      nickname1 - The nickname of the first player.
      nickname2 - The nickname of the second player.
      nickname3 - The nickname of the third player.
      bookShelf1 - The bookshelf of the first player.
      bookShelf2 - The bookshelf of the second player.
      bookShelf3 - The bookshelf of the third player.

    • printOthersPoint

      protected void printOthersPoint(String nickname1, String nickname2, String nickname3, List<Integer> pointPlayer1, List<Integer> pointPlayer2, List<Integer> pointPlayer3, Integer total1, Integer total2, Integer total3)
      Prints the points of other players along with their nicknames.
      Parameters:
      nickname1 - The nickname of the first player.
      nickname2 - The nickname of the second player.
      nickname3 - The nickname of the third player.
      pointPlayer1 - The points of the first player.
      pointPlayer2 - The points of the second player.
      pointPlayer3 - The points of the third player.
      total1 - The total points of the first player.
      total2 - The total points of the second player.
      total3 - The total points of the third player.
